name: stereospecificity
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the property of a chemical reaction in which the position of the atoms within the molecules (= a unit of a chemical substance made of a group of two or more atoms) involved in the reaction controls the result: Stereospecificity is central to biochemistry, and even small changes in the shapes of molecules can have profound effects. There appears to be limited stereospecificity for anti-malarial activity among the acids that we tested.
More examplesFewer examplesThis form of the fatty acid is favoured by nature, another example of stereospecificity. This circumvents the lengthy, inefficient organic synthesis that is otherwise required to create such stereospecificity.
